  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 'Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually. 3 Without the veil of the testimony, in the tent of meeting, shall Aaron order it from evening to morning before the Domina continually; it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations. 4 She shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the Domina continually.

 5 And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth parts of an ephah shall be in one cake. 6 And thou shalt set them in two rows, six in a row, upon the pure table before the Domina. 7 And thou shalt put pure frankincense with each row, that it may be to the bread for a memorial-part, even an offering made by fire unto the Domina. 8 Every sabbath day she shall set it in order before the Domina continually; it is from the children of Israel, an everlasting covenant. 9 And it shall be for Aaron and her daughters; and they shall eat it in a holy place; for it is most holy unto her of the offerings of the Domina made by fire, a perpetual due.'   10 And the daughter of an Israelitish man, whose mother was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel; and the daughter of the Israelitish man and a woman of Israel strove together in the camp. 11 And the daughter of the Israelitish man blasphemed the Name, and cursed; and they brought her unto Moses. And her father's name was Shelomith, the son of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.
12 And they put her in ward, that it might be declared unto them at the mouth of the Domina.

 13 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 14 'Bring forth her that hath cursed without the camp; and let all that heard her lay their hands upon her head, and let all the congregation stone her. 15 And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying: Whosoever curseth her God shall bear her sin. 16 And she that blasphemeth the name of the Domina, she shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall certainly stone her; as well the stranger, as the home-born, when she blasphemeth the Name, shall be put to death. 17 And she that smiteth any woman mortally shall surely be put to death. 18 And she that smiteth a beast mortally shall make it good: life for life. 19 And if a woman maim her neighbour; as she hath done, so shall it be done to her: 20 breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; as she hath maimed a woman, so shall it be rendered unto her. 21 And she that killeth a beast shall make it good; and she that killeth a woman shall be put to death. 22 Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for the home-born; for I am the Domina your God.'
